description: Navigate a minimalist maze to collect dots while outsmarting tactical ghost agents.
rationale: This game focuses on pathfinding, spatial awareness, and strategic avoidance. It targets developers and AI researchers interested in grid-based navigation and multi-agent systems where the player must optimize movement to maximize score while minimizing risk.
details: The game consists of a 2D grid maze containing 180 dots and 4 power pellets. The player (Pacman) starts in the lower-middle section. Four ghosts (Blinky, Pinky, Inky, Clyde) start in a central box. Ghosts have two modes: Chase and Frightened. Power pellets turn ghosts blue (Frightened), allowing Pacman to eat them for bonus points. The game ends if a ghost touches Pacman unless the ghost is in Frightened mode. The maze layout includes warp tunnels on the left and right edges. Logic must be implemented for ghost AI: Blinky targets Pacman's current cell, Pinky targets 4 cells ahead, Inky uses a vector between Blinky and Pacman, and Clyde moves randomly if too close to Pacman.
how_to_stop: kill the process using Ctrl+C or closing the pygame window
how_to_play: Objective: Eat all dots in the maze. Use Arrow Keys (Up, Down, Left, Right) to change direction. Scoring: 10 points per dot, 50 points per power pellet, and 200, 400, 800, 1600 points for consecutive ghost captures during a single power pellet effect. Total score is displayed on the top-left corner. Game Over occurs if Pacman loses all 3 lives.

state_space_for_rl.observation: 2D integer array representing the grid (0: empty, 1: wall, 2: dot, 3: power pellet, 4: Pacman, 5-8: Ghosts)
state_space_for_rl.reward_function: Positive for eating dots/ghosts, negative for collisions with active ghosts, small negative penalty per step to encourage efficiency
